hi and welcome you listening to the x22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1394a and today's date is
October 6 2017 and the thought of the
episode is did the BLS just manipulate
the wage data now before I get started I
just want to make an announcement I
uploaded an interview with Charles Hugh
Smith so all you need to do is go over
to with the x-22 report spotlight
YouTube channel and you'll find the
video there or you can come over to the
x-22 report comm site or news sentinel
comm scroll down look over to your right
hand side you'll see the video there and
you can play it right on the site or you
can go to steam it and that is steam
accom /at x-22 report the video is also
on steam it and you can play it right on
the site let's get into the economic
collapse financial news now economists
as they're looking at the United States
Europe UK and many other countries
they're trying to figure out why the
economies are starting to deteriorate
why aren't they doing as well as they
should if we're in this fantastic
recovery why are we seeing different
countries basically implode on
themselves and why are we seeing retail
fall apart GDP fall apart and they're
trying to figure out why all this is
happening and what's very interesting
about all of this they always beat
around the bush and they never go right
to the heart of the matter that the
central banks they're the problem
they're putting countries into a huge
amount of debt and as you keep piling on
the debt and asking for austerity guess
what happens the economy doesn't do as
well and when people can't find jobs it
makes the situation even worse which
then leads into decline and retail to
decline in housing housing decline in
GDP and it's just a snowball effect out
in the UK productivity while that has
fallen and the economy is lagging right
now output per hour fell around 0.1
percent in the three months through June
and they're trying to figure out why
this is all happening why is this
happening out there and here in the
United States we can see the same thing
is happening the economists are trying
to figure out why is this all happening
now when we use common sense and we
track everything day to day
week to week and we look back over the
years we can see that slowly but surely
how the central bankers destroy an
economy and we've been watching the
economy here in the United States and
we're watching it how on how they
destroy it and we can see exactly why
these things are happening right now the
US consumer comfort that has plunged the
most in 13 months Americans confidence
suffered its biggest biggest weekly
setback in more than a year and people
are not optimistic about their personal
finances and what we're seeing is that
the buying climate is deteriorating
right now people are looking at the
economy looking at their funds looking
at what they have and they're saying you
know something we just don't have the
funds to do this right now and
especially those individuals that are
losing their jobs now the payroll
information the unemployment information
came out and we can see that the
unemployment numbers they have dropped
to about 4.2 percent right now again
we've been watching this for a very long
time we know it's completely manipulated
and we understand that they're trying to
make the economy look really really good
before the whole thing falls apart and
if you look back in time the
unemployment rate drops the same exact
way right before a huge major recession
and this is what we are seeing right now
and what we're seeing is that something
very interesting happened the
hospitality sector
well those jobs they just completely
imploded they drop by like something
like a hundred eleven thousand jobs here
and that is just awful and they're
trying to explain away why the
unemployment rate has fallen why things
are looking good even though the
hospitality jobs have dropped off
they're saying that we're getting all
these full-time jobs and once again
they are playing with their numb with
the numbers they're revising they're
making everything look a lot better than
what it really is today and we can see
right now when we look at the data and
we look at what the BLS is throwing out
there they always go by the u3 number
and this is seasonally adjusted they go
back they make a lot of revisions
and they make it look a lot better than
it really is but what we're seeing right
now is the BLS might have been caught
fabricating wage data now this is the
most closely watched statistic in
today's payrolls report the BLS reported
that the annual increase in average
weekly earnings was a whopping 2.9
percent above the 2.5 percent expected
and above the 2.5 percent reported last
month on the surface this was a great
number
the 2.9 percent annual increase whether
distorted by hurricanes or not was the
highest since the financial crisis
however a huge problem emerges when you
look at this just one month prior at the
revised August data now andrew zetlen of
south bay research noted that the total
private average weekly earnings this
line posted another solid increase of
0.2 percent month-over-month an upward
revision from the previous month 0.1%
and when you look at the components it
becomes clear that the BLS fabricated
the numbers and may simply they might
they might have just simply hard-coded
this number into their spreadsheet with
the intention of goal seeking a specific
number now what it shows is that whereas
there are a sequential decline in the
average weekly earnings for goods
producing and private servicing
producing industries which are the only
two sub components of the total private
line of negative point 80% and negative
point one percent the BLS also reported
that somehow the total of these two
declines was a point two percent
increase now when you look at this it's
impossible because the two sub
components of the subtotal decline with
the total increases the math just
doesn't work out ands Atlin notes that
this is completely impossible unless you
hard-coded something in there to give
you a specific number and this is what
they have done now they've contacted the
BLS
seeking an explanation for the
fabrication of data now if they're
fabricating this data you bet that
they're fabricating other data and
there's many people out there like John
from shadow stats where he looks at the
numbers and does the calculations and
shows that yeah these numbers are
manipulated this is the real
unemployment and we're north of around
22% right now we are nowhere near 4.2
percent again we have to understand how
they do this they count part-time jobs
as a full-time job so if somebody has
two part-time jobs it's two full-time
jobs those people have given up and have
not been on an interview within
something like four weeks or so it
they're counted as falling off and
they're just not looking and there's
many other variables that go into this
that they use to manipulate the data the
revisions and everything else so we
could see right now they are completely
fabricating everything just to keep the
illusion alive now we can see the
housing market is falling apart very
very quickly home sales in the Greater
Toronto Area they plunge by 35% in
September compared to a year ago now the
plunge in volume was pretty much spread
across all types of homes detached
houses negative 40% semi detached houses
negative 30% townhouses negative 34%
condos negative 27% and when you look at
this you can see that things are rapidly
changing because if you use Zolo which
is a Canadian real estate site they're
saying that the housing prices they are
dropping and the Greater Toronto Area is
down around 17% from the April peak of
around 800,000 to 665,000 in September
why is this happening well we discussed
this before the flow of Chinese money
it's basically fallen off because the
Chinese are now investing in their belt
and Road system the Silk Road and
they're taking the companies the
investment companies and investors and
telling them to take what you're going
to invest and invest it in the belton
Road and we can see right now
this is going to hurt the real estate
market remember the individuals in these
countries they're sitting on the
sidelines because many people can't find
jobs many people don't make enough to
pay for these type of homes and this was
all being done by hedge funds investment
companies they were being done by
foreign entities and we can see that
this is holding true once again because
as the Chinese pull back their funds we
can see the housing market is taking a
hit can you imagine if interest rates
tick up just a little bit and hedge
funds and investment companies decide
you know something we're not purchasing
homes what do you think is going to
happen to the housing market it's going
to come crashing down now just a couple
months ago maybe even eight months ago
Vancouver Toronto these were like oh
look at the houses there it's never
coming down the housing market is going
to continually move up up up and up and
all of a sudden we see things are
starting to rapidly fall apart now we've
also looked at pensions here in the
United States and we know there's many
different areas where they're having
problems where they're completely
underfunded and we can see right now in
Illinois there's a problem we can see
Kentucky there's a problem
and Stanford there's another problem and
if we look there's a map of all the
different municipalities where there's
going to be major major problems with
pensions with municipalities maybe going
bankrupt we see Chicago is a problem
Houston is a problem we see Baton Rouge
is a problem Fort Worth Oakland Phoenix
Jersey City Pittsburgh I mean these are
a lot of different areas where there's
going to be a huge amount of problems
now in most of these areas the only way
you can get around this is maybe to have
like a 30% tax hike or a 76121 percent
increase in worker pension contributions
to fix many of these problems some are
higher some are lower but we can see
that they are in a huge amount of
trouble right now
and if you're in one of these areas and
you're looking for a pension you might
want to look into this to see what is
really going on and do they really
the funds to pay out over that specific
period of time now something very
interesting with the Fed we know that
the second-in-command Stanley Fischer he
resigned and he resigned unexpectedly
from the Federal Reserve and many people
were scratching their head why did he do
this at this point in time well when we
look back in time we can see that there
were other central bankers that resigned
right before something hit and Stanley
Fischer was on Bloomberg TV and he says
he's expecting higher inflation which is
going to hit very very soon he said I
still believe we will have higher
inflation now when you look at this and
you hear what he's saying you can see
that we're heading to that point and we
discuss inflation before where a lot of
the Fed houses they're saying it's
running at two point nine percent three
percent and we know they've been
offshoring or putting the inflation and
stuffing into the stock market the
college tuitions
and everything else we see that this is
going to be major problem now it's not
really that difficult to connect the
dots here the last time the US had a
major inflationary spike was in the 70s
and the head of the Federal Reserve at
the time Paul Volcker was fired so it
looks like Fischer decided I need to
bail on this because I see much higher
inflation coming and the whole thing is
going to be a complete and utter
disaster and we know that higher
inflation is headed our way the central
banks are continually printing money and
we can see that there's a lot of
countries out there that are moving away
from the dollar and once again those
dollars need a place to go they're going
to come back to United States we're
going to see the devaluation of the
dollar which means precious metals will
go up in value we're gonna see the cost
of goods go up in value or it's going to
take a lot more dollars to buy those
goods so we can see that we are headed
in this direction and those people that
are jumping ship right now they're doing
it for a specific reason because they
understand what is coming they already
know what is coming they can pretend
that they have no idea but at this point
we can see that
the economy is deteriorating very very
quickly we see the housing market and
it's already starting in Toronto
Vancouver it's already starting in
certain areas in the United States and
if you go outside of those 20 cities
that Case Shiller looks at and that the
Fed pumps up you can see that real
estate is having a major major problem
right now and as we move forward this is
just going to get worse it's not going
to get better and it doesn't matter what
the unemployment numbers say because
when you see many people out of work and
we know there's a lot of stores closing
a lot of people losing their jobs and
remember when a part-time person loses a
job they might have been counted as a
full-time job but if they're not working
a certain number of hours and getting a
certain number of pay they're not
counted as losing a job so what we see
here is one gigantic manipulation and we
can see how they can manipulate the
entire market and this is what we're
seeing right now the entire system is
cracking and falling apart right in
front of our eyes and this will
accelerate I know it started out very
very slow and we first started talking
about this but we can see how things are
actually changing right now nothing
happens overnight the Fed those who are
in control it takes a very long time to
pump up an economy they can't do it in a
year or two they need to do it very
slowly they need to build confidence
they may they need to make people think
that everything is fine and they do this
on purpose they're very patient very
methodical and once they get to this
point where everyone is feeling good
that's when they pull the rug out from

this is why you need to be ready and
prepared because we're getting very
close to that point
listen everyone thanks a lot for
